conclusion: Calculate gravitational force exerted by remaining part of sphere on point mass m after smaller sphere is removed.
Original sphere has mass M and radius R; point mass m is located at distance 2R from center O.
Gravitational force F0 exerted by original sphere on m is F0 = GMm/(4R^2).
Mass M' of removed sphere is M/8.
Center of removed sphere is at distance 3R/2 from point mass m.
Gravitational force F' exerted by removed sphere on m is F' = GMm/(18R^2).
Net force F exerted by remaining part of sphere on m is F = F0 - F'.
Combine fractions to simplify expression for F.
Simplified expression for F is F = GMm(7/(36R^2)).
Gravitational force F exerted by remaining part of sphere on point mass m is F = 7GMm/(36R^2).
